item.title: The host galaxies of 106 rapidly evolving transients discovered by the Dark Energy Survey
item.description: Rapidly evolving transients (RETs), also termed fast blue optical transients, are a recently discovered group of astrophysical events that display rapid luminosity evolution. RETs typically rise to peak in less than 10 d and fade within 30, a time-scale unlikely to be compatible with the decay of Nickel-56 that drives conventional supernovae (SNe). Their peak luminosity spans a range of -15 < M_g < -22.5, with some events observed at redshifts greater than 1.
